div.div:
Hazards
Activity Hazard Initial Risk Control Measure Residual Risk Responsible Person
Preparation
Induct worker and check competency Competency, personal injury, substances High Induct workers into business, check workers competency & experience, train as required, supervise work if inexperienced. Low Manager
Discuss work process with workers Incorrect Equipment use, Personal injury Medium Ensure worker familiar with equipment, tool and installation operation & wears suitable PPE e.g. boots Low Manager and Workers
Setting Up
Parking and setting up work area Inadequate access/ High egress for workers & pedestrian High Assess area for best place to park and set up away from pedestrian walkways, set up bollards if required Low Manager and Workers
Slip, trip, strain, sprain, Hand injuries Medium Clear all work areas, use suitable gloves, correct manual handling technique, share load with team lifts, use mechanical aid if required e.g lifting trolley
Low Workers
Other workers, pedestrians Medium Identify obstacles and other work activates (pedestrians, other workers, etc) around work location. As required, remove obstacles and set up exclusion zone around work
Low Manager and Workers
Setting up & using fall arrest system
Select ‘right’ fall restraint/arrest system Incorrect fall restraint / arrest system will not work effectively and cause injury to person High Use fall restraints to prevent person becoming close to unprotected edge. When fall arrest system used, ensure shock absorber fitted, but only for falls greater than the length of lanyard and chock absorber combined. Inertia reels only used when fall restraint and fall areas systems impractical. (second fall protection)
Medium Workers
Select anchorage type Person injured by incorrect or inadequate anchorage High Select most suitable system, restraint device such as static line, SWL rated sling for tile installed around truss of house or a temporary screwed anchorage point for tin roof
Medium Workers
Person injured by anchorage failing High Where possible, anchorage point to be located directly above user on peak of roof. Provide safe access anchorage point. Check, confirm anchorage point can support the imposed load of falling worker anchorage points only installed by competent person
Medium Workers
Installing anchorage point on roof Ladder slipping off roof High Use ladder mate then secure ladder to roof. Ensure ladder is on firm even ground . Medium Workers
Fall from height High Install anchor point on opposite side roof form ladder, throw rope over roof and connect to anchor point, connect to that rope on other side of roof and use to install 2nd roof anchor point on peak of roof above work area
Medium Manager and Workers
Installing rail, wiring & installing panels
Working on Roof Fall from roof High Install anchor point on opposite side roof form ladder, throw rope over roof and connect to anchor point, connect to that rope on other side of roof and use to install 2nd roof anchor point on peak of roof above work area
Medium Manager and Workers
Incorrect fall restraint / arrest system will not work effectively and cause injury to person High Install anchor point on opposite side roof form ladder, throw rope over roof and connect to anchor point, connect to that rope on other side of roof and use to install 2nd roof anchor point on peak of roof above work area
Medium Manager and Workers
UV Exposure, dehydration, Heat & sun stress Medium Provide cool drinking water, consume liquids. Keep hydrated. Provide and use suitable PPE including Low Workers
High Wind exposure High All tools and materials that are not fixed and could be blown away from an elevated position, should be relocated to an unexposed and secure area
Low Workers
Wet weather causing slippery surface High If roof becomes slippery, stop works and remove all personal off roof Medium Workers
Screwing in feet and rail Manual handling Medium Use correct lifting techniques, 2 person lift if too heavy Low Workers
Repetitive strain injury Medium Stretch in regular intervals, take regular breaks if required, stop & stretch if feeling stiff or soreness Low Workers
Grinding tiles Dust, inhalation form drilling Medium Use goggles, dust mask, gloves, good ventilation, have first aid kit nearby Low Workers
Noise Medium Wear hearing protection and wan other immediate Area Low Workers
Carrying Panels High wind exposure High If wind is to high stop panelling and wait till wind dies off. Ensure all panels are screwed down or removed. All tools and materials that are not fixed and could be blown away from and elevated position, should be relocated to an unexposed and secure ares
Low Workers
Wet weather causing slippery surface High If roof becomes slippery, stop works and remove all personal off roof Low Workers
Mounting Panels Manual handling Medium Use correct lifting techniques, 2 person lift if to heavy Low Workers
Repetitive strain injury Medium Stretch in regular intervals, take regular breaks if required, stop & stretch feeling stiff or soreness Low Workers
Installing Inverter
Working in switch board Working near live electrical cables and services Extreme Isolate switch board so all circuits are dead. Test circuits for dead and confirm tester functionality. If working near line side of main switch pull service fuse and test for dead and confirm tester functionality. Ensure someone is close by while isolating circuits.
Medium Workers
Electrocutions Extreme Treat all Boards, devices & wiring as Live until status confirmed as NOT LIVE. Wear suitable protective clothing, carry test equipment.
Medium Workers
Physical & mental fatigue High Consult with workers on workloads and schedules. Workers involved in repetitive tasks exceeding one hour must take regular hourly breaks, at least 5 minutes, every hour or earlier where the worker feels bodily tired
Medium Manager and Workers
Inadequate competency or knowledge of procedure, substances, etc may cause personal injury Medium Check worker competency & experience, ensure worker familiar with welder operations, trains as required, supervise worker if inexperienced
Low Manager and Workers
Installing Inverters Dust, inhalation from drilling Medium Use goggles, gloves, good ventilation, have first aid kit nearby Low Workers
Strain from manual Handling Medium Use correct lifting techniques, 2 person lift if too heavy. Mechanical aid if required Low Workers
Hand, foot, head, & eye injuries Medium PPE worn such as gloves, safety boots, hard hats, high visibility clothing & protective eyewear Low Workers
Cuts & punctures from drilling Medium Drill away from body, secure piece you are drilling into. Wear gloves if required Low Workers
Commissioning
Turning on inverters Electrocution Extreme Ensure all covers have been put back in place and that there are no exposed live parts. All screws are down up Tight Medium Workers
Arc Flash High Ensure all covers have been put back in place and that there are no exposed live parts. All screws are down up Tight. Medium Workers
